newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares seen down for fourth session running.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares seen down for fourth session running.

text.p: Polish shares were expected to fall for the fourth session running, with Friday's central bank decision to increase mandatory reserves on zloty term deposits from April 30 seen hurting banks especially.
Analysts said the market, currently at 16,316.6 points, could find support at 15,500.

Analysts also said NFI units could extend their recent fall after the finance ministry's decision last Thursday to scrap in 1998 the corporate tax exemption NFIs enjoy on gains from selling firms in their portfolios.
